medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has been experiencing intermittent epigastric pain for the past 6 months, occasionally radiating to the LUQ and RUQ. The pain, described as sharp then dull, worsened with food and was associated with bloating. Early episodes were self-resolving. The patient reported fever, nausea, and vomiting two months ago, and has described episodes of sweating with the pain. Diarrhea lasting seven months with loose, foul-smelling, non-bloody stools was noted. Two weeks ago, the pain worsened, became more constant, focused on the epigastrium and LUQ, associated with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes type 2, hypertension, obesity, sleep apnea, testosterone deficiency, diarrhea, back pain.
